Doctors strike.description: KOLKATA: Junior doctors in Bengal finally called off their week-long strike and promised to resume duty on Tuesday morning, ending a stir that crippled out patient departments (OPDs) and severely hit emergency services at hospitals across the state. At a meeting held at state secretariat Nabanna on Monday evening, West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee told a team of 31 junior doctors, " Lakkhi chhele, ebar tomra strike tule nao (Please withdraw your strike like good boys)", which they agreed to. The "cordial" negotiations between the CM and doctors were broadcast live for about 100 minutes by two regional channels. The doctors, who had adopted a strident posture against the administration for the initial police inaction against the kin of a bereaved patient at NRS Hospital last Monday (incident that triggered the stir) relented in the face of genuine-sounding assurances from the CM. The state administration medical fraternity face-off escalated after Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee issued a stern warning of action against the strike during her visit to SSKM Hospital last Thursday. What could have also played on their minds was the rising public opinion against the continuing strike, especially after the CM's appeal for talks last weekend. The striking doctors returned to the NRS campus on Monday and, after another general-body meeting, made a statement: "We hereby announce the withdrawal of the strike by junior doctors." Several issues were discussed at the meeting. They ranged from security measures - collapsible gates for emergency wards, regulated entry for patients' kin and enhanced police presence on medical campuses with nodal officers responsible for law and order - to the CM's suggestion for third-party PR professionals, who could act as grief counsellors and handle communication between "overworked doctors" and "aggrieved patients' kin" and grievance cells for patients. "We are delighted with the cordial manner in which the meeting was held, the CM's caring touch and concrete suggestions and assurances to the issues raised by us," one of the junior doctors said. "They (doctors) have genuine demands. We have listened to them and taken decisions to resolve them. This must be a continuous process. We have to see to it that such untoward incidents are averted and action is taken if something happens," Mamata said. The CM's "gentleness", however, came with the message that she could not be bullied. Urged by the junior doctors to visit the doctor who was injured in the NRS attack, and come to the NRS campus, she said, "Leave certain things to us...Give me your word that you will resume duty." Brigitte Oppinger-Walchshofer and Jean Claude Kugener (BCCL/ Aditya Yadav)  Amrita Das, Jagdish Gandi and Finous (BCCL/ Aditya Yadav)  Geeta Kingdon, Julia and Mona (BCCL/ Aditya Yadav) Ricky Kej, Roger and Roshan Gandhi (BCCL/ Aditya Yadav) Armed with a 368-piece orchestra, with 118 musicians and 250 chorus artists from 17 foreign nations and also musicians from 11 states of India, the performance witnessed a jam-packed auditorium with people also coming in from outside of the city to listen to ‘their own Upadhyaya’. Lucknow: Conmen pose as STF, dupe woman.description: LUCKNOW: Two men impersonating as STF officials robbed a woman of her ornaments in Mahanagar by conning her on Monday. This is the 40th such incident in the city in this year alone. The complainant, Kusumlata Dubey of Badshahnagar railway colony, informed the police that two unidentified miscreants stopped her near Rajkiya Balika Inter College in Nishatganj on Monday morning. “They introduced themselves as STF officials and told me that a murder had taken place in the locality. Intimidating me in the name of checking, they forced me to take off my gold chain and put it in a paper bag they had. They gave me the bag but when I opened it, I found there were pieces of stones inside it,” she told police. CO Mahanagar Santosh Singh said, “We are working on the menace of conning in the city. The modus operandi shows that a specific gang is on the prowl and is pretending to be cops to con people.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Organised at the school campus, the celebrations witnessed ladies coming from all across the globe inlcuding the USA, the UK and Germany to meet their friends.  Vipra Sriwastava (L) and Deepika Chaturvedi with Vidhi Bhragava (BCCL/ Aditya Yadav)  (L-R) Prakash Mohini Bhargava, Kamla Advani, Madhur Bhatnagar and Trishna Tandon (BCCL/ Aditya Yadav)  (L-R) Anjuman and Mekhola (L) and Mridul (BCCL/ Aditya Yadav)  Shiamin (L) and Veena (BCCL/ Aditya Yadav)  (L-R) Bina, Manju and Kumkum (BCCL/ Aditya Yadav) Sister Anjuman, principal of the school, while welcoming the ladies, said, “I feel so happy to see such vibrant faces back in the school. It’s amazing to see that 50 glorious years have passed and still that bond is so fresh.” Deepika Saxena, who came all the way from Washington, and was visiting the college after a long gap said, “It’s a wonderful experience for me to meet my friends after 50 years. I am reliving my golden days again.” As a token love, the ladies gifted a set of benches and swings to the school. — Prachi Arya In Video:An all-girls party at this school reunion in LucknowDownload The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Yogi Adityanath.description: VARANASI: Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath slammed Congress president Rahul Gandhi for suddenly showing concern for the poor and asked why he didn’t ensure a minimum income scheme for them during Congress-led UPA regime when his mother Sonia Gandhi acted as ‘super prime minister’ and had a say in everything. Targeting Congress announcement of minimum income scheme for poor on coming to power, Yogi said, “Congress led UPA was in power in Centre from 2004 to 2014. Everybody knows how Rahul and his mother (Sonia Gandhi) were influential in UPA regime. However, in UPA’s 10-year regime Congress never showed the kind of sympathy for poor, unemployed, farmers and women of country like it is showing now for Pakistan.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Shiv Sena List 2019.description: MUMBAI: Shiv Sena has come up with it's first list of 21 candidates, out of 23 to contest in Lok Sabha polls in Maharashtra. Except Osmanabad, 17 sitting Sena MP's are part of the list, includes Mumbai, Thane, Kalyan, Raigad. Following complaints received by local functionaries from Osmanabad, the party has denied ticket to sitting MP Ravindra Gaikwad. Gaikwad, who had allegedly hit an Air India staffer with his slipper because he was refused a business class seat in March 2017. Maharashtra: Track here Lok Sabha elections' full coverageSena has kept two seats, Palghar and Satara, on hold, likely to announce on Sunday. Late Chintaman Wanga, former BJP MP's son Shrinivas likely to contest from Palghar on Sena ticket whereas former NCP legislator Narendra Patil may might contest as Sena candidate from Satara. Patil met Shiv Sena president Uddhav Thackeray on Friday at Matoshree. Other candidates are: South Mumbai: Arvind Sawant; South Central Mumbai: Rahul Shewale; Mumbai North West: Gajanan Kirtikar; Kalyan: Shrikant Shinde; Raigad: union minister Anant Gite; Osmanabad: Omraje Nimbalkar, Ratnagiri-Sindhudurg: Vinayak Raut; Kolhapur-Sanjay Mandlik; Hatkanangle: Dhairyasheel Mane; Nashik: Hemant Godse; Shirdi: Sadashiv Lokhande; Shirur: Shivajirao Adhalrao Patil; Aurangabad: Chandrakant Khaire; Yavatmal Washim: Bhawana Gawli; Buldana: Prataprao Jadhav; Ramtek: Kripal Tumane; Amrawati-Anandrao Adsul, Parbhani: Sanjay Jadhav; Maval: Shrirang Barne; Hingoli: Hemant Patil. ATM cloning gang busted in Azamgarh.description: LUCKNOW: Azamgarh Police has busted a gang of cyber criminals who were not only stealing the money of gullible debit/credit card holders but causing a major dent to the banking sectors. Two people identified as Suraj Yadav (25) and Sujeet Yadav (28) was arrested on a surveillance input from Tarwan police station area on Saturday. The accused had bought a card reader and skimmer from online shopping websites. Suraj and Sujeet owned a common service center (CSC), which helps in getting e-service of government. They used to target people who used to come to this center and made payment through their cards. These devices like-card reader, writer and skimmer can be bought from Amazon, e-bay or Indiamart by paying Rs 35,000. These devices were misused by Suraj and Sujeet to copy the data of credit/debit cards of the customers who used their common service center, said the police. Explaining the modus-operandi, Azamgarh Superintendent of Police Triveni Singh said the accused had the franchise of CSC and a micro-ATM (swiping machine). "Customers visiting to get the government's service were targeted and their cards were cloned. They got access to their ATM pin by recording their password by installing a secret camera," said Singh. First the accused used to copy card data on blank cards. Cloned cards were then sent to cities like Mumbai and Pune from where money was withdrawn. Card cloners used to get 25 % commission of the total amount withdrawn, said the officer. Azamgarh police have found 5,000 data from the customer. Cops are now going to write to National Payments Corporation of India (NCPI) for mapping of such crimes. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Ex-cop, wife lived with daughter\u2019s.description: VARANASI: A retired sub-inspector of police, Dilawar Khan, and his wife lived with the decomposed body of their 30-year-old daughter for over a month in Hathiyaphatak area under the limits of Katra Kotwali police station in Mirzaputr district. On Monday morning, police seized the body and sent it for postmortem. ASP (City) Mirzapur PS Pandey said, “We are awaiting the postmortem report of the deceased Zeenat to know the actual cause of her death. As we have not received any complaint so far no decision has been taken yet to lodge a case.” Police said Dilawar was living at his parental home in Hathiyaphatak area along with his wife and daughter Zeenat. “His two sons, Anwar and Aftab, are settled in Aligarh and had not visited their parents for the past three years,” police added. Locals said Zeenat had died over a month ago. “The stench of the decaying body was being felt by us since a week after her death. We informed the police about it but whenever they visited the place, Dilawar told them to produce a search warrant for entering his home,” said a neighbour. Pandey admitted that “people of Hathiyaphatak had complained about the stench but Dilawar never allowed the police to enter his house”. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\nSpreading cheers among cops\u2019 kids.description: A cultural event Children Summer Carnival was held recently at the Reserve Police Line, Mahanagar. The event was organised by the UP Police Family Welfare Association for the wives of the Uttar Pradesh policemen. The guest of honour at the event was Neelam Singh, a lawyer and the wife of the Director General Police UP. The event exhibited paintings and drawings by children which sought much attention. The event also spread awareness regarding voting among those present.  The highlight of the event was the dance competition where children participated in good numbers. A classical dance reciatl by Unnati Giri won many hearts and a Bhangra dance performance on Punjabi songs was loved by most.  (L-R) Kalanidhi Naithani, Sarvesh Kumar Mishra and Vijay Shankar Agnihotri (BCCL/ Vishnu Jaiswal)  (L-R) Vikrant Vir (L) and Abhishek Verma and Manju Srivastava (BCCL/ Vishnu Jaiswal)  (L-R) Dr Anshita Verma (L) & Kalyani Verma and Dr Pravin Ajaz (L) and Anshu (BCCL/ Vishnu Jaiswal)  Deepti (L) and Saeeda Saira (BCCL/ Vishnu Jaiswal) Present at the event was Minakshi Krishna Sima Modi, Dr Pravin Ajaz, Niharika Singh and Shephali Bhagat among others. — Vishnu Jaiswal In Video:Spreading cheers among cops’ kids in LucknowDownload The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Dad\u2019s the way for their pooch lover.description: Fatherly love is not just confined to humans, feel dog owners in the city. Talk to these proud pooch owners in Lucknow and they say that their pets are no less than their kids. These innocent animals give the gift of unfathomable love to their ‘fathers, which is usually not talked about. This Father’s Day, we talk about these furballs and how their owners/fathers feel about them.  (BCCL/ Vishnu Jaiswal) Businessman Anurag Mishra, who happens to be a proud father of almost 37 dogs, has raised each one of his ‘kid’ with unconditional love. “I have always lived with a dog, in fact, almost raised by one. As a child, the dog I was raised with, was my constant companion. He used to tickle me, play with me. So, every day is Father’s Day for me as far as my ‘babies’ are concerned. My kids keep showering their love and I keep reciprocating. This is a feeling that only a pet lover like me can understand that these dogs are our babies only,” says Anurag, getting emotional.  Cyrus Cowasji with a few of his ‘kids’ (BCCL/ Vishnu Jaiswal) Kunal Lamba, who happens to be an animal activist along with wife Caroline, is a proud owner of more than 70 rescue dogs. While talking to us he jokingly says, “I think after about 70, I stopped counting. The amount of love and affection I have for these innocent animals is something which even I cannot fathom. My kids (dogs) are the reason why I met my beautiful partner. They are so lucky for me. So, yes, these are my beautiful kids and even the way I treat them is like a father treats his kids. The same pampering and the same scolding that a human kid would get from his father, these pooches get the same from me. At the end of the day, I am their dad only!” Telling us about his plan to celebrate Father’s Day with his kids, Kunal adds, “Today, I’m planning to make a collage out of their paws dipped in paint and get the collage framed. That is the best gift that these kids will give me.” Asteya Awasthi’s pooches sharing some fun time with their dad (BCCL/ Vishnu Jaiswal) Owner of a dog’s cafe in the city, Asteya Awasthi says, “The first time I held my baby Auli, a golden retriever, in my hand that fatherly feeling came forth. It was as if I was holding my own baby. In fact, the same is the case with all my dogs. My kids have been with me through all good and bad times in my life. Their love is always unconditional. Yes, sometimes, just like a human kids would do, they too throw tantrums and sulk, but then we make up after a small tiff.” Cyrus Cowasji, who owns a lot of these furry babies, is planning a Father’s Day treat for his kids. “Since my dogs love to swim, I am taking them out for a swim to a pool. With some light music, I am sure they are going to have loads of fun with their dad. It is actually a treat watching them swim,” says Cyrus.  Doggy dad Anurag Mishra surrounded by his ‘babies’ (BCCL/ Vishnu Jaiswal) High school student Ayush Chaturvedi, who owns a two-and-a-half-year old Labrador named Bruno, while gazing at his dog lovingly, says, “Just like a father would feel that urge to hold his child in his arms, I too feel the same craving. Sometimes I have these sudden urges to pick up my Labrador but I can’t since he’s so big.”Jokingly Aayush adds, “In most cases dogs obey their masters, but in my case, I obey my dog. This Father’s Day I’m planning to bake a cake for my Bruno and take him out along with his friends for a drive.” - Yashi Agarwal In Video:Dad’s the way for their pooch lovers in LucknowDownload The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Lucknow: Stray bull attacks, injures cor.description: LUCKNOW: The failure of Lucknow Municipal Corporation (LMC) in tackling the stray cattle menace in the city despite 14 attacks being reported in last two months led to one of its own members — corporator of Geetapalli ward Arvind Yadav — becoming a victim and sustaining injuries when a bull chased and assaulted him on Friday night. As many as three persons have died and 24 injured in attacks by stray cattle in the state capital in last two months. Besides, nine members of LMC cattle catching squad have also been injured while trying to catch strays during drives. Arvind’s relatives told TOI that he had gone to talk to the junior engineer of Jal Sansthan regarding low water pressure in his area. While he was on his way back to home, a stray bull chased him and pinned him down on the road. The locals at the spot rushed to save Yadav and took him to a nearby hospital. When TOI visited Geetapalli ward on Saturday, local resident Anchal Praveen, said, “We all are living in a state of fear as these stray animals are everywhere, but the civic and administration officials are just sitting in their offices and not doing anything.” LMC officials said there were around 4,000 stray bulls in the city of which 2,000 have been caught in the past month. Besides, there are 3,500 stray cows on the streets. “We have conducted one drive against strays in the area and will launch another soon. Some of our staff members sustained injuries while catching cattle, hence our drive lost the steam and was hit,” said LMC chief veterinary officer Arvind Rao. Gang supplying spirit to hooch shops bus.description: LUCKNOW: With the arrest of seven persons, UP Special Task Foce (STF) on Sunday claimed to have busted a gang supplying rectified spirit (used to make illicit liquor) to countrymade liquor shops in districts like Barabanki, Lucknow, Sitapur, Chitrakoot, Kanpur Dehat. STF sleuths seized more than 5,000 litres of rectified spirit and 1.10 lakh QR (quick response) code slips of different English and countrymade liquor brands from the accused. The accused were all natives of Rae Bareli and were nabbed from Bachhrawan area of Rae Bareli . STF SSP Abhishek Singh said that Suraj Lal, who has been arrested, was the gang leader. The gang smuggled rectified liquor from one Gyanendra in Fatehpur and smuggle them to various places in Barabanki, Lucknow, Sitapur, Chitrakoot, Kanpur Dehat for preparing illict liquor and then selling to countrymade shops. “Lal used to make a profit of Rs 2,000 on the sale of each set of illicit liquor,” said Singh. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Urmila Matondkar.description: MUMBAI: The Congress on Friday nominated actress Urmila Matondkar and former Lok Sabha speaker Meira Kumar from Mumbai North and Bihar's Sasaram parliamentary constituencies respectively. The party renominated its sitting MP Ranjet Ranjan from Supaul in Bihar, as it released a list of another 12 candidates for the general elections. With this list, the Congress has so far nominated 305 Lok Sabha candidates. Urmila Matondkar to contest from Mumbai North parliamentary constituency on a Congress ticket.… https://t.co/JweKWNh1FN— ANI (@ANI) 1553836382000It also changed its candidate in Uttar Pradesh's Maharajganj by now fielding Supriya Shrinate in place of Tanushree Tripathi, the daughter of jailed politician Amarmani Tripathi, after facing widespread criticism. "The Congress central election committee has approved the candidature of Urmila Matondkar as party candidate to contest the ensuing general elections from Mumbai North parliamentary constituency in Maharashtra," a party statement said. Matondkar had joined the Congress after meeting Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday and had later said that she was "here to stay". Meira Kumar have been contesting from her Sasaram parliamentary constituency for many years but had lost in the 2014 Lok Sabha polls. Apart from Supriya Shrinate, in the list of 12 candidates released by the party, four are from Bihar and seven from Odisha. The Congress also released a list of 20 candidates for Odisha Assembly election. Satta Market.description: BHOPAL: This assembly  is turning out to be a nail-biter. The Bhopal satta bazaar that gave BJP a good chance three weeks ago is suddenly abuzz about Congress’ prospects. As per the bookies, till about a month ago, if a person placed a bet of Rs 10,000 on BJP, he would get Rs 11,000 if the party returned to power. And anyone who bet Rs 4,400 on Congress would get Rs 10,000 if the opposition wins. This week, bookies say, they are taking bets on number of seats and not on who would form the government. “In case no party gets absolute majority, or if the scoreline is too close,” explained a bookie. “We do not want to say which party will form the government. The bets are open. The satta market is running good this poll season, as it is a thrilling contest,” he added. Bookies told TOI that satta trends may not reflect the actual situation on the ground, but the market is accepting bets on 116-plus seats for Congress and 102 or more for ruling BJP. “Anyone who bets successfully on BJP or Congress will double his money,” a bookie said, adding that this trend may change just as suddenly in the next few days as campaigning gets more intense. The same bookie had told TOI around a month ago that rates may vary once candidates are finalised by the parties, “but we expect the trend to remain the same”. The satta market runs into crores in every election. Bets are placed not just over phone, but also on websites and apps, leaving almost no room for police to track down bookies and those placing bets. Probably, this is why no gang has been busted in the state so far for running an election betting racket. At least two cases of betting are registered daily in Bhopal, but the people pulling the strings of the racket in poll season are yet to be caught. Police officers say it is getting increasingly difficult to nab such gangs because they are constantly on the move. “Online betting can be operated even from a moving car, a café or any public place anywhere in the country. Those running the betting in Bhopal may be sitting anywhere on the globe,” said an officer. SP-south Rahul Kumar Lodha said a special campaign is being run against criminals involved in gambling and betting ahead of elections. “These criminals are made to sign bonds to prevent them from committing such crimes in the future. Raids are being conducted on specific tips. A list of habitual offenders is being prepared by police stations to curb such illegal activities,” he said. ASP-crime Rashmi Mishra said the crime branch has activated its network of informers prior to elections to keep an eye on betting. “It is difficult to crack online betting and gambling rackets, but police take action against criminals on specific inputs. For instance, we were tipped off on Monday night about a betting den in Kolar. It was raided but no such activity was found,” Mishra said, adding that the cyber cell is constantly on the lookout for websites and mobile apps used by betting rackets. UP: Dalit man burnt alive in Pratapgarh.description: LUCKNOW: A dalit-man was allegedly burnt alive under Patti police station area of Pratapgarh in Uttar Pradesh on Monday. The incident came to light when the villagers in Belarampur village woke up and went to the fields only to find charred body of one Vinay Prakash Saroj (33). They later informed the kin of Saroj. Pratapgarh SP Avanish Mishra told TOI that Saroj had come to sleep in the fields for guarding his haystack on late Sunday night. The sequence of events leading to the death of Saroj is yet to be ascertained. "The post-mortem examination is being conducted which will provide clues in the causes of his death. We are yet to get any complaint from the kin of deceased so far,” added Mishra. Uttar Pradesh chairman of SC/ST Commission Brij Lal has condemned the incident and instructed the police to arrest the accused. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Hindi, Sanskrit UG seats at Lucknow Univ.description: LUCKNOW: Though the state capital is included with prominence in what experts call the ‘Hindi heartland’, there are few takers for the language as well as Sanskrit from which it is said to have been derived. Both Hindi and Sanskrit failed to attract candidates seeking admission in undergraduate course of Lucknow University and most seats are vacant. Hindi failed in its heartland with students taking no interest in learning the national language. Among the 39 subject combinations offered by LU in BA, maximum seats are vacant in Hindi and 50% seats are vacant in functional Hindi. There are 400 seats of Hindi in BA but as many as 108 are vacant while only 15 of 30 seats in functional Hindi have been filled. Similarly, not many were inclined to learn Sanskrit as 35 of 80 seats in the subject and all 30 seats in functional Sanskrit remaining vacant. The fate of Persian is no better with not a single candidate applying for even one of the 60 seats. Likewise, only 5 seats of the 60 seats in Arabic have been filled. “The fall in popularity of Hindi and Sanskrit at higher education level is because of poor quality of education imparted at school level where students are not encouraged to study these subjects,” said Prof Ravikant of Hindi department. He said that though students are running towards professional courses, it’s the failure on part of teachers and academic institutions who fail to generate interest of students in literature and languages. More than 50% seats are vacant in Urdu and French as well. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

UP: Youth throws acid on girlfriend\u201.description: LUCKNOW: Angry over his girlfriend’s marriage getting fixed with another youth, a man allegedly threw acid on the girl’s would-be husband and mother-inlaw at their home in Huzurpur area of Bahraich. The victims, Harinam, 25, and his mother Anita (48), who suffered minor burns are recuperating at a government hospital, police said. The accused, who is yet to be identified, is on the run. SHO Huzurpur Manoj Kumar Rai told TOI: “Around 9.30pm on Saturday, a youth scaled the boundary wall of Harinam’s home and threw acid over Anita and then on Harinam. As victims were asleep, they could not react immediately. The attacker soon fled the spot.” Some neighbours tried to chase the attacker but in vain. SP Bahraich Gaurav Grover said an FIR on the charges of causing hurt by weapons has been registered against an unidentified person. Preliminary probe has revealed that Harinam’s marriage was fixed with a village girl last week, Grover said, adding that apparently that girl was in a relationship with a youth from another village. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Lucknow beams with happiness on Happy St.description: Just like the streets of Chatori Gali have become synonymous with Happy Streets, so are its fans who have been a part and parcel of the event since its inception in Lucknow. While the family of Happy Streets is growing every passing year, the excitement among the revellers who have been constant with the event from Season 1 to Season 4, remains the same. Zoha Azeem and her family have been attending Happy Streets since it became a part of the City of Nawabs. "When I first attended the event, I came along with my family and a bunch of school friends. This year, when we saw the Happy Streets ad on TOI's Facebook page, I told my parents not to schedule anything for Sunday. Though we stay in Indiranagar, we make it a point to learn activities here and make new friends," said Zoha. Another loyal visitor, Harish Choudhary said it is his love of roller-skating that brings him to the event every season. "Roller skating is the most sought after activity for youths and adults alike, while Zumba is the one which majorly attracts youngsters here. It was here that I first learned a few techniques from the fellow skaters. It has been giving a platform to children like us to showcase our talent and take it forward in the future," he said. "We have been attending Happy Streets often as the children get to run around the vehicle free streets. They can jump, laugh and play with other children in the area," said Mona Roy, a resident of Gomtinagar. The Happy Street craze is not only visible among the residents, but also the trainers at the event. " We never miss an opportunity to walk along the Happy Street. We feel proud that we get a chance to perform and show our skills in a traffic less space," said Arti Jaiswal, a martial arts trainer. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Sadhvi Pragya.description: NEW DELHI: BJP MP from Bhopal Sadhvi Pragya Singh Thakur created a controversy on the first day of 17th Lok Sabha on Monday when she suffixed the name of her spiritual guru with hers while taking oath, drawing objections from the opposition. Amid protests and shoutings, Thakur said that it was her full name and she had already mentioned it in the form she had filled for oath taking. The mention of Swami Purna Chetnanand Avdheshanand Giri as suffix to her name evoked sharp reaction from the opposition members who said that such a thing was not permitted. She insisted that the suffix was part of her full name, resulting in an uproar from opposition and slogan shouting in her favour from the ruling benches. Following the din, Pro-tem Speaker Virendra Kumar asked the Lok Sabha secretary general about Pragya's full name. Amid noise and objections, Kumar ruled that only the name written in her election certificate issued by the returning officer would go on record. Thakur, the Malegaon blast accused, took oath in Sanskrit and ended it with 'Bharat Mata Ki Jai' slogan. Thakur defeated Congress stalwart Digvijay Singh to enter the Lok Sabha for the first time. Later, BJP members continued to raise 'Bharat Mata Ki Jai' slogans, teasing the opposition. They started raising slogan after oath taking by every BJP member. After Ganjendra Umarao Singh Patel (BJP) completed his oath with 'Bharat Mata Ki Jai', N K Premchandran (RSP) urged the Pro tem Speaker to maintain the prescribed format of the oath. The Pro tem speaker ruled that the members stick to the format provided. After this, the members of BJP started adding 'Bharat Mata Ki Jai' after end of every oath. Some of the prominent names who took oath from Madhya Pradesh included K P Yadav who defeated Jyotiraditya Scindia, Rakesh Singh, Ramakant Bhargava and Nakul Nath. Indore MP Shankar Lalwani took oath in Sindhi. In Video:Lok Sabha: Sadhvi Pragya made to take oath againDownload The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

July 30 deadline for Aadhaar enrolment o.description: LUCKNOW: The state government has given a July 30 deadline to the education department to complete the Aadhaar enrolment of over 50 lakh schoolchildren taking admissions in classes up to VIII across the state. The 12-digit unique identity number would be used to filter out fake beneficiaries of government schemes such as free of cost school uniforms, shoes, text books, midday meal and scholarships, said an official. Besides these students of 1.58 lakh government schools, Aadhaar enrolment of students of all recognised private and aided junior high schools would also be done. The director for basic education has appointed a nodal officer for completion of the work within 30 days. Secretary of Basic Shiksha Parishad Ruby Singh said, “The mass exercise will help us in removing fake beneficiaries of government schemes. The unique number will be written in the enrolment register of every child and will act as a reference number for the children during distribution of uniforms, books, shoes and meals, among others.” The instruction has been passed on to all recognized private and aided junior high schools in cities and rural areas. UP midday meal authority director Abdul Samad told TOI, “It is not that we will stop giving meals to children who do not have an Aadhaar card. But the basic education department should ensure that kids availing the schemes have the card by July-end. This will ensure transparency in the mammoth project.” The state education department has signed a memorandum of understanding with the Unique Identification Authority of India for completion of the project. Besides, an agency would be entrusted with the task of making Aadhar cards in schools under each of the 822 development blocks of the state. Around a crore students study in 1.13 lakh primary and 45,700 upper primary schools of the state. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

PM Modi.description: JEYPORE: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday said his government had taken measures to set up a 'chowkidar' in space and asked people to vote for a government that can take concrete decisions and not just raise slogans. Launching his campaign in eastern India with a rally in Jeypore area of Odisha's Koraput district, the prime minister said the NDA government wouldn't have been able to do any development work in the country without the support of the people. He sought blessings from his supporters for the 2019 Lok Sabha elections and asserted that the NDA government has left no stone unturned to bring about development in the state. Land, air or space, we had courage to do surgical strikes: PM Modi"The NDA government has been working hard to develop road and rail infrastructure in the state. There is no dearth of funds when it comes to development work in the country. "In the last five years, the government has been able to build homes for eight lakh families, light up 3,000 houses and provide gas connections to 40 lakh homes," Modi stated. Referring to Mission Shakti, when India demonstrated anti-satellite (ASAT) missile capability by shooting down a live satellite, he said the government has taken measures to set up a 'chowkidar' (watchman) in space. He came down heavily on opposition parties who he said "belittled" the space achievement. "Those that are criticising the anti-satellite technology will be given a befitting reply in the elections," he claimed, urging people to vote for a government that can take concrete decisions, not the one that only raises slogans. In Video:Govt has taken measures to set up 'chowkidar' in space: PM Narendra Modi in OdishaDownload The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Clouds, gusty wind to cool Lucknow today.description: LUCKNOW: Gusty winds and partly cloudy sky might bring down temperatures by a degree or two on Tuesday. There is also a possibility of rain and thunderstorm. On Monday, the weather was hot and humid. The maximum and minimum temperatures were 40.9 and 27 degrees Celsius respectively and relative humidity was between 31% and 86%. State Met director JP Gupta said strong winds and partly cloudy sky are because of the western disturbance over the Himalayas. It may cause a thunderstorm on Tuesday and Wednesday at several places in the state, including Lucknow. Monsoon advancement is slow and is expected to reach the city by the end of the month. Trauma centre to come up along Agra e-wa.description: Along with petrol pumps, chief minister Yogi Adityanath has said that more restaurants, dhabas and a trauma centre should also be built along the Lucknow-Agra Expressway. Reviewing the work of UPEIDA on Monday, the CM further directed that one official each should be made responsible for the Purvanchal Expressway, Bundelkhand Expressway, defence corridor and Ganga Expressway. These officials will be posted on the field to monitor the projects on a continuous basis. They will be required to submit regular reports to the government to ensure that all the projects are completed on time. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Tamil Nadu Elections.description: Voting for Lok Sabha elections 2019 in Tamil Nadu will take place in a single phase on April 18 as per the notification issued by the Election Commission of India. The counting of votes will take place on May 23. | Lok Sabha elections 2019: Get all live updatesThe four-cornered contest for the 39 Lok Sabha seats features AIADMK-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA), its chief rival DMK-led Secular Progressive Alliance (SPA), actor Kamal Haasan's Makkal Needhi Maiam and TTV Dhinakaran's Amma Makkal Munnetra Kazhagam (AMMK). Out of the 39 seats in the state, seven Lok Sabha seats are reserved for SC. The constituencies reserved for SC candidates are Thiruvallur, Kancheepuram, Villupuram, Nilgiris, Chidambaram, Nagapattinam and Tenkasi in Tamil Nadu. | Tamil Nadu Lok Sabha elections: Get all live updatesIn the last Lok Sabha polls, AIADMK had a vote share of 44.3 per cent by winning 37 seats. BJP had a vote share of 5.5 per cent by winning just 1 seat, while NDA managed to win two seats with a vote share of 18.5 per cent PMK won one seat and had a vote share of 4.4 per cent. BJP (NDA) had an alliance with PMK. DMK was not able to win on any seat in the last Lok Sabha polls. In Lok Sabha elections 2019, DMK is contesting on 20 seats, while the Congress is fighting elections on 9 seats in Tamil Nadu. In the AIADMK-BJP alliance, the national party will be contesting from five seats in the state while the PMK will be contesting from seven. Ministers get addl charges as colleagues.description: LUCKNOW: Amid speculation of a cabinet expansion after three ministers were elected as members of Parliament in the recently concluded Lok Sabha elections, the government has, for the time being, distributed their portfolios among sitting ministers. Governor Ram Naik accepted the resignation of three ministers on Monday and has approved of the distribution of their portfolios as additional charge to other ministers, as recommended by chief minister Yogi Adityanath. Of the portfolios held by SP Singh Baghel, the animal husbandry and fisheries departments have been handed over to minister of dairy development Laxmi Narayan Chaudhary while Dharam Pal Singh, who already holds the irrigation portfolio, also gets minor irrigation. Rita Bahuguna Joshi’s departments of family welfare, and mother and child welfare have been given to health minister Sidharth Nath Singh while the chief minister has kept women welfare and tourism. Industries minister Satish Mahana will hold charge of all departments previously held by Satyadev Pachauri which include khadi and village industries, sericulture, textile, micro, small and medium enterprises and export promotion. Lucknow: Two workers choke to death in s.description: LUCKNOW: Two sanitary workers were choked to death while cleaning a sewer near Matiyari crossing in Chinhat on Saturday. The deceased were identified as Shahbuddin, 23, and Raidul, 18. The duo fell unconscious due to poisonous gas in the sewer and slipped to the bottom of the pit and dies of suffocation. Another sanitary worker, Maidul, who was standing on the road and passing on the equipment to Shahbuddin and Raidul sensed some trouble when he stopped getting any response from the duo. He raised an alarm and dialled UP 100. A police team arrived at the spot along with firefighters but by that time Shahbuddin and Raidul had died. It took cops and firefighters two hours to take the bodies. According to the police, Shahbuddin had taken a sub-contract of cleaning the drain from a contractor who works for a government agency. Station house officer, Chinhat, Sachin Kumar Singh said the bodies have been sent for postmortem. Their family members have not lodged any complaint so far, he added. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Chanchal Lahiri.description: KOLKATA: After a day-long search for magician Chanchal Lahiri (41),   who disappeared   while performing an underwater escape act in the Hooghly, police on Monday fished out his body from near Howrah. Later in the evening, Lahiri's brother identified his body. An initial police probe established that Lahiri on Sunday had made several mistakes while attempting the stunt popularised by the famous illusionist and stunt performer Harry Houdini almost 100 years ago. Mandrake trying similar stunt earlierMMiC still in shock after magician’s deathLahiri, who was to come out of the water after being thrown in with his hands and feet bound, , but also wore cumbersome clothing and guards that made swimming in the strong current extremely difficult. Magician PC Sarkar, a master of such stunts, said perhaps Lahiri "needed a little more practice". Lahiri's team, too, waited about 15 minutes after he was lowered into the water to raise an alarm. Chanchal Lahiri on the boat moments before he started the stunt on Sunday Lahiri’s hands and legs were tied with ropes and he was chained with six locks. "When he did not surface for a long time, people panicked. Some onlookers said they saw a man struggling, seeking help, in the middle of the river. Police were informed and a team of divers from the disaster management group joined the rescue operation," said DC (Port) Syed Waquar Raza. Cops will probe if he took advantage of some lacunae on part of the administration and probably paid for it with his life. "A case of negligence is likely to be registered," said a source. Lahiri being lowered into the Hooghly river as he performed one of his tricks in KolkataMagician’s body found; peers say he didn’t take proper precaution Sources said Mandrake never mentioned in his permission letter that he was going to jump into the water. "Lahiri stated the stunt was to happen on a boat or vessel. Hence, we allowed him permission," Raza said. The letter added that he wanted to take photographs and perform an extra event around 1.30pm. The final dip made by Chanchal Lahiri"He performed almost an hour earlier. Hence, river traffic police was absent," said a Port division officer. Police said Lahiri drowned around 12.30pm and it is unclear whether he was performing or practising the act. Moments before the stunt on Sunday, Lahiri said, "If you perform a dangerous trick perfectly, you are a magician. If you fail, it is always tragic." Mandrake's body was fished out on Monday"Bound and chained, Mandrake was lowered 30 feet under water. Thousands watched and it is impossible the cops missed the entire episode when even politicians were present," claimed a friend on Monday. In 2013, when Lahiri performed the same stunt, he was assaulted by the crowd of onlookers, who claimed they felt cheated because they had seen through the trick. In Video:Kolkata: Magician drowns in Hooghly while attempting underwater Houdini escape actDownload The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP List 2019 WB.description: KOLKATA: The BJP in its first list of 28 candidates for West Bengal has pinned hopes on its veterans and defectors from the ruling Trinamool Congress to take on the Mamata Banerjee's government in the state. Of the 28 candidates, nearly 25 are new faces, with a thrust on active political workers rather than greenhorns from the glamour world. The saffron party, which bagged two Lok Sabha seats in the 2014 elections, is now targeting 23 of the state's 42 constituencies. BJP Lok Sabha first full listUnlike the TMC list, which had 18 new faces and a mix of both old-timers and greenhorns, hardcore politicians and personalities from the film industry, the BJP has put faith on its own leaders and defectors from other parties. There are four women candidates and one Muslim nominee in the first list. Of the candidates, five had recently defected to the saffron party from the Trinamool Congress and one from the CPI(M). West Bengal: Track here Lok Sabha elections' full coverageUnion minister and BJP MP from Asansol Lok Sabha constituency Babul Supriyo has been renominated from the same seat and is pitted against actor Moon Moon Sen of the TMC. State BJP president Dilip Ghosh will contest from Medinipur seat against TMC leader Manas Bhunia. BJP national secretary Rahul Sinha will take on TMC heavyweight Sudip Bandopadhyay in Kolkata North Lok Sabha seat. State BJP vice-president and Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose grandnephew, Chandra Kumar Bose will contest from Kolkata South Lok Sabha seat. Former IPS officer Bharati Ghosh, once known to be close to Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee, will be fighting against TMC candidate and actor Dipak Adhikary, popularly known as 'Dev', from Ghatal Lok Sabha constituency. The BJP has fielded former Trinamool Congress MLA Arjun Singh from Barrackpur Lok Sabha seat. Singh, who had recently joined the saffron party, has been pitted against TMCs Dinesh Trivedi. In Coochbebar Lok Sabha seat, the party has fielded former TMC youth leader Nishith Pramanik, while in Jadavpur Lok Sabha seat, expelled TMC MP Anupam Hazra will contest against TMC's Mimi Chakraborty, an actor by profession. Another former TMC MP Soumitra Khan, who joined the BJP in January, has been given ticket from Bishnupur(SC) Lok Sabha seat. Former CPI(M) MLA Khagen Murmu, who too had switched over to the BJP, will contest from Malda North seat and will take on TMCs Mausam Benazir Noor, who had recently defected to the party from the Congress, in Malda Uttar seat. The Lok Sabha elections in the state will be held from April 11 till May 19 in seven phases. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Lucknow: Duo cloned cards in garb of ser.description: LUCKNOW: Two cyber criminals stealing money through card cloning were arrested in Azamgarh on Saturday. The duo was identified as Suraj Yadav, 25, and Sujeet Yadav, 28. Suraj and Sujeet ran a common service center, which helps in getting e-service of government.  They targeted people who visited their centre and made payment through their cards. The accused had bought a card reader and skimmer from online shopping websites to commit the crime. “Customers visiting to get the government’s service were targeted and their cards were cloned. They got access to their ATM pin by recording their password by installing a secret camera,” said SP Azamgarh Triveni Singh. First the accused used to copy card data on blank cards. Cloned cards were then sent to cities like Mumbai and Pune from where money was withdrawn. Card cloners used to get 25 % commission of the total amount withdrawn, said the officer. UP: Gorakhpur zoo to get lions from Guja.description: LUCKNOW: After Akhilesh Yadav, the Yogi Adityanath government is bringing lions from Gujarat for the chief minister’s pet project — Gorakhpur zoo. While Gujarat lions led to a verbal duel between then UP CM Akhilesh Yadav and BJP’s PM-candidate Narendra Modi in 2014 when the state government brought lions for Etawah Lion Safari, this time it is a quiet advent of big cats, six of whom are females. UP government has got the official custody of the lions after Gujarat CM Vijay Rupani gave the lions’ handing-over certificate to VK Singh, director, Etawah lion safari and NK Janoo, director, Gorakpur zoo last week. Gujarat government has agreed to part with eight lions from Junagarh zoo without seeking any animals in exchange from UP. The lions will be kept in Etawah Lion Safari till Gorakhpur zoo is ready to house them, and that could be not before November. Also, Gorakhpur zoo has a capacity for only three lions. The rest of the felines, therefore, might stay in Etawah safari. Though the final decision on lions’ stay would be taken by the state government. The eight big cats were initially set to reach Etawah by May 22, but the blistering heat forced the forest department to postpone the plan. “We will bring lions as soon as rains start which could be by the end week of June,” said V K Singh, director, Etawah Lion Safari. Four of the safari keepers had already been to Junagarh and spent 10 days with the lions to get the first hand feel of each of its behaviour and habits. The same set of keepers accompanied the officers to Gujarat this time as well. While officers will come back keepers have to stay. In Etawah safari, lions will be kept in isolation for 21 days after which they will be moved to their new destination. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Lucknow: Children fit fitness into their.description: The first day of powerpacked Happy Streets not only attracted Lucknowites to reclaim their streets but also served a special purpose! The venue saw father-kid duo’s spending a quality time with each other on Father’s Day on Sunday. A large number of fathers were seen celebrating the day with their kids while peddling down the road. Manik Anand participated in a bicycle race with his teenage daughter Saanvi. “Though my father cheated during the race, I didn’t complain because today is his day. That is why I let him win... He is too busy during week days. Happy Streets also gave me a chance to fit fitnesses into his lifestyle,” said Saanvi. Five-year-old Ayyan was a happy lot on Sunday. He always wanted to learn to ride a bicycle with his father, but couldn’t do so due to his busy schedule. With an array of activities, he not only enjoyed the event but also fulfilled his wish of learning the ride with his father. “He always stayed busy round the clock. It was difficult for him even on Sundays to take out time from his hectic schedule. Today, he came around with me and not only played games, but also danced with me during the fitness session,” said Ayyan. Echoing similar sentiments was Madhu Mishra, who attended Happy Streets for the first time with her father. “Social media has taken a toll on us because of which we are spending less time interacting with our parents. Happy Streets encourages us to step out of our home with our parents. Since today is a day dedicated to the fathers, I couldn't think of a better Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

In dry summer, CM seeks relaxation in dr.description: LUCKNOW: With many parts of India staring at drought, chief minister Yogi Adityanath on Saturday urged the Centre to lower the limit of crop loss from 33% to 20% to declare an area as drought affected. The CM made the suggestion at the fifth governing council meeting of Niti Aayog chaired by PM Narendra Modi in Delhi. Yogi also raised the problem of floods in many parts of UP during monsoon every year. He said the central government should assess the extent of damages within a month after floods so that relief measures may be put in place in time. The CM also asked for increase in funds under the state disaster relief fund. Yogi also demanded deployment of CRPF companies in UP’s Naxal affected districts of Sonbhadra and Chandauli. His demand comes days after the Centre sought to withdraw central paramilitary forces from Naxal affected areas in UP. Yogi suggested that the Kisan credit card should be linked with the cropping area instead of the quantum of crop so that farmers may get requisite credit. The CM cliamed that UP government had ensured a transparent mechanism of distributing ration through e-POS machines. Recounting the achievements of his government, Yogi said the state was committed to the welfare of farmers. He claimed that more than Rs 68,000 crore have been paid in the form of cane dues. In the last two years, he said, the quantum of cane crushing increased by over 45%, while 38% women have been included under MNREGS and added that more women would be brought under its ambit. The CM also said that irrigation facilities in Bundelkhand region have been expedited by getting 8,384 ponds dug up in 2017-18. On the power front, Yogi told the gathering, the state government has built 613 new 33/11 sub-stations and enhanced the capacity of 761 sub-stations. The CM claimed that more than 2.91 crore households were electrified in the state by March 2019. These included over 90 lakh newly electrified homes under Saubhagya and Deendayal Upadhyaya schemes. Mahagathbandhan.description: NEW DELHI: Taking a swipe at the grand alliance of opposition parties, finance minister Arun Jaitley on Friday said the 'mahagathbandhan' is a 'non-bandhan', political circus and a recipe for chaos. Several political parties, mostly traditional BJP opponents, have come together to take on the National Democratic Alliance (NDA) in the ensuing general elections beginning April 11. In a blog post, Jaitley said that over the last several months, India was "exhausted" with the talk of a 'Mahagathbandhan'. The rationale, he said, was that Prime Minister Narendra Modi and the BJP were very strong and could not be challenged by individual party. Stressing that Indians judge politicians by their merit and capacity and no longer by any traditional loyalty, he said: "We were promised a 'coalition of rivals' because India had to be saved. We were promised a common minimum agenda. Each leader amongst the aspirant Prime Ministers wanted to become a 'sutradhar' (anchor) of the alliance. He/she would periodically organise shows in his/her State and invite the entire bandwagon." In opposition camp, Jaitley said there is a tussle for leadership as already multiple candidates have made their desire clear to take over the mantle of the leadership. According to him, each one of them is interested to see the strength of the other party's contender depleting and also have high hopes in a chaotic and highly hung Parliament. "He/ she believes that only in a chaotic situation he/she has a chance," said Jaitley, who is heading the BJP's publicity division of the seven-phase Lok Sabha elections. The past track record of such governments in terms of policy, longevity and growth has to be borne in mind, he said adding their track record of corruption is equally well-known. Jaitley further said it is only because of the size of the BJP and clarity on leadership in the last coalition that a successful government was run under Prime Minister Modi. "Today you have no 'gathbandhan' let alone 'mahagathbandhan'. It is a 'non-bandhan'. You have no leader, no programme, no meeting of minds. "Stability, which is paramount, is a major casualty. The only thing in common is negative agenda 'remove one man'. It is a recipe for chaos," he said in the blog titled 'A Political Circus Called 'Mahagathbandhan'. The nominations for the first two phases of polling are over and those for the third phase are about to happen. The results will be announced on May 23. All new bus stations to be outside citie.description: LUCKNOW: All bus stations will be constructed outside towns and cities from now on. The instruction came from chief minister Yogi Adityanath on Monday during a review of the transport department. The stations should serve multiple purposes, he said, each having multilevel parking and shopping plazas, etc. Directions have been given for construction of bus stations at Baghpat, Shamli and Chandauli. Meanwhile, to subsidise travel for those living in rural areas, the chief minister has said that bus passes should be issued to them at “reasonable rates”. In view of the upcoming traffic safety week, the CM has asked transport department officials to begin a crackdown on overloaded vehicles and those violating traffic rules. The CM has also asked the department to carry out a programme in schools for two weeks, from July 15 to 30, and teach students about traffic rules. It was also shared that after becoming the first state in the country to start issuing e-challans, the department had issued e-challans of Rs 5.97 crore in 2018-19. A literary Metro ride on north-south cor.description: LUCKNOW: Until recently, not many young ears in the city were attuned to the nuances of poetry. But thanks to a group of youths, the scene is changing. Passengers travelling from Munshipulia Metro station to CCS Airport were in for a surprise on Saturday evening, when a group of people oraganised an open mic session full of poetry, storytelling and music. Creating a literary atmosphere on board, the open mic event titled Navonmesh was a fourth public event hosted en route the 45-minute ride, organised by nine youngsters. From traditional ghazal to shayari, the youths caught the attention of passengers travelling on the north-south corridor. Anshuman, who performed a poetry titled Musafir, said, “Open mic sessions are becoming a regular feature of the city. Today, the added zing to such event is that it is happening in a Metro and allowing us to entertain the people.” As language was no bar, participants read out their favourite poems in an array of languages, from Hindi, English to even Urdu. Another performer, Anup, who began his poetry with a recital of Saraswati vandana, said, “Such events allow you to make the best use of whatever space is available, and also engage with more new upcoming artists in the crowd.” Lucknow Metro is slowly becoming a hub of literature and art, as over three events have so far been organised on the north-south corridor. From a chess tournament and mushaira to a poster-making competition, these activities seem to be a hit among the commuters. “Sports, literature and arts event add an aesthetic value to our daily monotonous routine and brings joy to the ennui of everyday travel in a Metro,” said Aavantika Bhatt, a commuter. On April 7, a chess competition was organised by LMRC, where children aged between 8 and 14 years participated. On April 28, Lucknow resident Mohammad Siraj Mehdi recited a mushaira on board throwing light on the past traditions of Lucknow and the present tech-savvy world. On May 17, LMRC organised a poster-making competition for schoolchildren from across the city. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

AMMK Candidate List 2019.description: CHENNAI: AMMK deputy general secretary TTV Dhinakaran on Friday released the second and final list of candidates - 14 for the Lok Sabha polls and 9 for assembly bypoll in Tamil Nadu. The party has decided to field two of its heavyweight disqualified MLAs to contest Lok Sabha polls and to take on strong candidates from AIADMK alliance. Disqualified MLA from Andipatti and AMMK propaganda secretary, Thanga Tamilselvan, has been fielded from Theni Lok Sabha constituency, he will take on P Ravindranath Kumar, son of deputy chief minister and AIADMK coordinator O Paneerselvam. Disqualified MLA from Paapireddipatti and former minister P Palaniappan will be contesting the Lok Sabha polls from Dharmapuri constituency. He will take on PMK youth wing leader and former Union health minister Anbumani Ramadoss, who is contesting on behalf of the AIADMK-BJP-PMK alliance.| Full coverage of Lok Sabha elections in Tamil NaduBesides these two, AMMK has also selected another disqualified MLA, NG Parthibhan from Sholingar assembly segment, to contest Arakonam Lok Sabha constituency. He will take on former Unions minister of state S Jagathrakshakan of the DMK - Congress alliance on the seat. AMMK had earlier released its first list of 24 candidates for Lok Sabha and 9 candidates for assembly bypoll in the state last Sunday. Dhinakaran will release the party's manifesto for the Lok Sabha polls later during the day. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\nLove for strays brought this couple to.description: Childhood BFFs, Kunal Lamba and Caroline Borges had a unique wedding recently at St. Joseph Cathedral Church. The two share a love for strays and looking after the ones in their neighbourhood brought them together.  Varun and Khushboo Lamba and Alisha Jackson (BCCL/ Farhan Ahmad Siddiqui)  Anju and Rajendra Lamba and Babita Lamba (BCCL/ Farhan Ahmad Siddiqui)  Dheeraj and Sonam Arora and Jennifer Borges (BCCL/ Farhan Ahmad Siddiqui)  Jeffrey Borges and Tina Frank (BCCL/ Farhan Ahmad Siddiqui) Caroline, looking resplendant in a flowing white gown made a grand entry in a vintage car, while Kunal waited for her with at the alter. After exchanging wedding vows, from the church, the couple celebrated the moment with their four-legged babies and fed them and played with them. “We believe that no one can be as pure in their love as animals and we wanted to cherish the moment where it all started for Kunal and me,” said an elated Caroline.  Khyati Lamba with Palak Shanker (L) and Hibah Beg (BCCL/ Farhan Ahmad Siddiqui)  Parveen Talha and Priscca and Beat Frank (BCCL/ Farhan Ahmad Siddiqui)  Raj Lakshmi Singh with Stephen and Andrey Griffs (BCCL/ Farhan Ahmad Siddiqui)  Rebekah Jackson and Ritu Mudgal Suri (BCCL/ Farhan Ahmad Siddiqui)  Twinkle & Shobhit Mehndi Ratta and Vandana Lamba (BCCL/ Farhan Ahmad Siddiqui) Following the church ceremoney, the wedding was also solemnized with Hindu rites, followed by a grand party where the couple, their parents, family and friends all danced with gay abandon. The enthusiasm of celebrating each other’s traditions was an inspiration to many. — Farhan Ahmad Siddiqui In Video:Love for strays brought this couple together in LucknowDownload The Times of India News App for Latest City .

If a #Metoo movement is there then there.description: TV actor Ravi Dubey of 'Jamai Raja' fame, was in Lucknow recently. The UP-born actor, who has a strong connection with the city, has been a frequent visitor here. But this time, with the temperature soaring to a record high, he too was feeling the heat. “It is extremely hot, one must say that! It is unbearable actually.” Recalling his childhood memories, Ravi says, “All my memories of summer vacations are of UP. Every year we used to go to our village Raghuapur in Deoria district, during summer vacations, and at that time there was no electricity there. We used to feel the heat thousand times more than what we feel now and I remember my grandmother waving those haathwale fans for us. We used to play in that heat only. A few years later, my father had brought a generator for our paternal home. So, I have a lot of memories of my childhood to share.” Ravi adds, “I think this is the magic of childhood. As a performer when you grow up with these experiences, it not only increase your adaptability to the surroundings but also helps you perform better in acting or anywhere else. You are able to connect with a common man in an effortless way. It has worked wonders for me, all thanks to my village for that!”  Ravi Dubey in Lucknow (BCCL/ Vishnu Jaiswal) Currently hosting 'Sa Re Ga Ma Pa Li'l Champs', the UP-born actor has not only participated in the adventurous reality show 'Khatron Ke Khiladi' but has also hosted a couple of non-fiction shows like 'Sabse Smart Kaun' and 'Rising Star'. Reiterating his love for hosting, Ravi says, “I don’t need to do TV or daily soaps just to stay in limelight. I am content hosting shows as of now. There was a time when a variety of stories with carefully crafted characters were written with much soul. But today it has gone down drastically. So, I am waiting for that quality of work which is content driven.” Ask him about his views on the much talked about #Mentoo movement and the 'Jamai Raja' actor says, “Before even talking about the #Mentoo movement, I would like to say one thing, the public trial or social media trial before judiciary taking over the matter is very unfair, in my opinion. That has to stop! It may be that he is guilty but it may also prove to be otherwise. You have to look at it from both points. Till the time you have seen and analyzed all the proof, don’t give your verdict. Kya kabhi aap apne aap ko maaf kar payenge agar apne kisi ki zindagi tabah kar di bina ye jaane ki woh galat hai ya sahi? Agar woh galat hai toh usse saza zarur den but till the time he is proven wrong, I think the benefit of doubt needs to be given to him. So, I think if a #Metoo movement is there then there should be a #Mentoo movement too.” — Abhishek.Shukla2@timesgroup.com Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Five persons including three toddlers di.description: LUCKNOW: Five persons including three toddlers died while 19 persons were injured when a tractor-trolley overturned in Maharajganj police station area in Balrampur district on early Monday. Police said that three persons-Bharat (25), his wife Resham (23) and his son Nanhu (03) died on the spot, while two others-Satish (03) and Nandini (01) of another family were declared brought dead at the government district hospital. Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath has expressed condolence on the incident and also instructed authorities to provide all possible medical aid to the injured. According to the police, around 3 am on Monday, 15 labourers working at a brick kiln with their families were on their way to Lohepaniya village when their vehicle reached Kovapur railway crossing the driver lost control on the wheels and the tractor overturned in a ditch. Hearing a loud thud, villagers woke up and informed the police. ASP (Balrampur) Arvind Mishra told TOI that eight persons have been discharged while 11 are still recuperating at the hospital. UP: Conmen pose as cops, dupe dentist of.description: LUCKNOW: Four unidentified miscreants posed as policemen and duped a dentist from Azamgarh of cash and gold ornaments on Sunday morning in Gomtinagar. The conmen struck when UP police officials, led by DGP OP Singh, were taking out a cycle rally to spread traffic awareness in Gomtinagar. The victim, Sachin Jaiswal said he had come from Azamgarh and was going to his friend Saurabh Maurya’s house at Sharda Apartment in Gomti Nagar extension when the miscreants duped him. “I got down from bus at Husadiya crossing and took a rickshaw for Sharda Apartments around 6.45am. Near power sub-station in Gomti Nagar extension, four youths stopped the rickshaw saying they were policemen and were conducting checking,” Jaiswal said in his complaint to police. “Two of them were of 35-40 year age group while other two were of younger and looked like between 25-30 years. They claimed to be cops and said that a murder had taken place in the locality and some weapons have also been recovered,” he added. “They asked me about my profession and then told me to keep all the cash, gold chain, ring and bracelet in the bag I was carrying. When I was putting the goods in bag, they took it handed me another and fled. When I opened the bag, it was empty,” he said. Talking to reporters, Jaiswal said that he runs a clinic in New Colony locality, Azamgarh, and had come to the state capital to purchase some equipment used in dentistry from an exhibition at Indira Gandhi Pratishthan in Vibhuti Khand. Gomtinagar circle officer, Avnishwar Chandra Srivastava said that police are scanning the footage of CCTVs installed on the stretch to identify the miscreants involved in the incident and also to ascertain the exact sequence of events. Priyanka Gandhi.description: RAE BARELI: In her scathing attack on BJP and Modi government, Congress general secretary Priyanka Gandhi said that Congress doesn't need any certificate from anyone to prove its nationalist feelings. "Ye brashtachar ki baat karnewale sabse bade brashta hain… kaam ki baat karte hain magar sabse bade nikamme hain… dharma ki baat karne wale sabse bada adharm kar rahe hain - dharm ka istemal kar rahe hain… saheedon ka istemal kar rahe hain - sirf rajinit ke liye (They are talking of acting against corruption but are corrupt themselves… they talk of work but are good for nothing… they talk of dharma (read duties) but indulge in adharma by defying its norms - they use religion and martyrs for political interests)," Priyanka stated in her closed door meeting with cadres on Thursday. The Congress leader hit out at BJP's strategy of playing the nationalist card. "We are Congress… we launched the freedom movement… gave our blood and sweat… braved British atrocities … we don't need any certificate to prove our nationalist feelings especially from the ones who apologised to the British at that time", asserted Priyanka, urging the workers to go to every household in their area and meet every voter. She directed the workers to apprise the voters that the 2019 Lok Sabha election was as important as the freedom movement. Infusing energy in them she said, "Don't be afraid of anything as this is a weak government. Only a weak government curbs the voice of the people, which is a crime in democracy." Priyanka asked the workers to stand up for their leader whose only dream is the progress of India and its people. "Rahul thinks of the people without any vested interest," Priyanka said citing the example of her conversation with Rahul on the issue of using self-help group women for campaigning. "When I proposed to him this idea, he simply denied… saying that I created the SHGs to empower women, not use them in any way," Priyanka said quoting her brother. The Congress general secretary told the workers that she was working on mission 2022. "We will, with your support, form the government in 2022. And once we come, we will stay here for long on the basis of our hard work," she said adding that the hard-workers would be adequately rewarded. Pawan Kalyan.description: GUNTUR: Stating that they will bulldoze bastions of TDP and YSR Congress, Janasena president Pawan Kalyan promised to grant Rs 5,000 pension to all farmers in the state. He said they will also grant Rs 8,000 crop incentive to farmers soon after coming into power in the next elections. Pawan further said his government would provide six to 10 LPG cylinders free-of-cost to each family every year. and also promised to fill 3 lakh vacancies in the government departments to provide jobs to youth. Addressing a meeting in Guntur on Monday, Pawan said that the future of the state did not mean the future of Lokesh and Jagan but it was the future of the people. “The space on the state’s political stage is not TDP’s and YSRC’s property as youth and women are eager to bring change through Jana Sena.” “TDP had lost moral right to rule the state as chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu had no control over his legislators who indulged in illegal activities,” Pawan said adding that he jumped into the political arena to bring in a change in the lives of commoners. “We supported TDP and BJP in the last elections with a hope to transform the state. Unfortunately, both of them have shattered our dreams,” he said. “Guntur city has been left in a lurch despite located a few kilometres away from the capital city. The entire city has been dug out in the guise of laying underground drainage scheme and left without repair. How shocking it is to see 30 people dying of diarrhoea in a city like Guntur? Is it not the failure of the state government? Opposition leader Jaganmohan Reddy is equally responsible for the tragedy as he never dared to question the government by going to the assembly,” he said. He further said they would construct apartments exclusively for Muslims in the city. He appealed to people to support his candidates Chandrasekhar (Guntur West), Zia-Ur-Rehman (East) and MP candidate Bonaboina Srinivas Yadav in the elections, Pawan said they fielded a BC candidate Srinivasa Yadav whereas TDP and YSRC both have given tickets to their own communities. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Anantnag Encounter.description: SRINAGAR: An Army Major died while another officer of the same rank and two soldiers were injured in a gunfight at Bidoora village, in Achabal area of south Kashmir's Anantnag district, on Monday, a defence spokesman said. A Pakistani terrorist was killed in the encounter. Major Ketan Sharma of 19 Rashtriya Rifles, who died in the Achabal encounter, belonged to Meerut. A police officer said they had found the body of a Pakistani terrorist and seized arms and ammunition from the encounter site. The identity of the slain terrorist was being ascertained. In another attack, at least nine Army soldiers were injured in an IED blast that targeted a security vehicle of 44 RR at Aarihal village in Pulwama on Monday evening. Those injured in the Achabal gunfight and IED blast were rushed to the Army's 92 Base hospital in Srinagar, officials said. In the third attack in 24 hours, terrorists lobbed a grenade at the headquarters of the 180 CRPF battalion camp in Tral sub-district of Pulwama late on Monday evening. The grenade exploded outside the headquarters. No casualties have been reported. The first attack happened on Monday morning when a team of security men was on a cordon-and-search operation in Achabal. Terrorists fired at the team, who then retaliated. In the Pulwama attack, the terrorists after setting off the IED, opened fire at the Army vehicle. "Initial reports reveal the vehicle suffered extensive damage," the official said. Three of the soldiers injured in the blast were said to be serious, sources said. Soon after the attack, Army, police and SOG reinforcements were rushed to the spot and a massive search operation was launched. A defence spokesman, however, said some of the men sustained minor injuries in the IED blast. Damage was minimal due to the alertness of the patrol party, he said. The vehicle was an armoured ALS and not a Casspir (a mine-resistant, ambush-protected vehicle), he added. Niti Aayog: Privatise power distribution.description: Lucknow: Government think tank Niti Aayog has recommended privatisation of power distribution to minimise line losses — or waste of electrical energy owing to overheating of wires. This has upset power employees who say this will invite strong protest. In a note to all states, including UP, the Niti Aayog has said distribution companies may adopt a franchisee model for retail business in rural areas and stipulate minimum performance parameters, including the use of decentralised generation sources and storage systems for local reliability and resilience. The recommendations come at a time the UP government is grappling with line losses, particularly arising out of power thefts, to the tune of 25-30% against an expected 15%. As of now, only Agra and Noida have entrusted private companies with power distribution. While Torrent does the job in Agra, NPCL works in Noida. Implementation of the Niti Aayog recommendation will mean that power distribution of other discoms such as Madhyanchal, Paschimanchal, Dakshinanchal, Poorvanchal and Kesco will rest with private companies, who will not only maintain infrastructure but also generate electricity bills for consumers. Energy minister Srikant Sharma told TOI the state government would review the recommendation before taking any further step. “The objective is to improve the power distribution system and the government is working in that direction,” he said. The development, nevertheless, has sent power employees into a tizzy. President of All India Power Engineers Federation Shailendra Dubey said any move to privatise distribution would invite strong protests. “Attempts have failed in the past 25 years. The energy department should initiate talks with power employees before taking another drastic decision. The aim should be to provide better and cheap power to consumers,” Dubey said. The federation plans to write to Union power minister RK Singh on the issue. The idea to privatise power distribution was first mooted under the Mayawati government in 2009, after which Agra was handed over to Torrent. The Akhilesh Yadav government came up with a similar plan for Kanpur, but the move was thwarted by power employee protests. Among its other important recommendations, the Niti Aayog has suggested performance-based incentive in the tariff structure. It has said that to manage the demand for power, it is necessary to introduce 100% metering, use of smart meters and metering of electricity supplied to agriculture. Jaya Prada.description: HYDERABAD: It’s been a roller coaster ride for actress Jaya Prada in politics. The actress, who started off as a Telugu film heroine dominating the scene along with Sridevi some decades ago, changed her political course on Tuesday by joining the BJP. In the last 25 years of her political career, she has changed several parties. Hailing from Rajahmundry in Andhra Pradesh, she began her political career with the Telugu Desam Party in 1994 as she had done several films alongside TDP founderpresident N T Rama Rao. After N Chandrababu Naidu took over as chief minister, he nominated her to the Rajya Sabha and she served a term from 1996-2002. While in the TDP, Jaya Prada had a running feud with Renuka Chowdhary who was also in the TDP then. When it became clear that she was being ignored in the TDP, Jaya Prada looked for greener pastures elsewhere. The Samajwadi Party led by Mulayam Singh Yadav in Uttar Pradesh got Jaya Prada into its party fold. She contested the Rampur Lok Sabha seat from that state on the SP ticket and won in 2004. In the 2009 elections, she got re-elected from the same constituency. With differences sprouting between SP leader Amar Singh and Mulayam Singh Yadav, Jaya prada had to make a choice on who she would sail with. She preferred to join the new party that Amar Singh floated but that proved to be a futile exercise. Jaya Prada then joined the Rashtriya Janata Dal, led by Ajit Singh in UP, making the move along with Amar Singh. In the 2014 elections she was fielded as an LS candidate from Bijnor but lost. For some time, there was speculation that Jaya Prada would return to the Telugu Desam Party when she met Andhra Pradesh chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu in Amaravati in November 2015. It turned out that she had met Naidu only to invite him for her son Siddharth’s wedding that month in Hyderabad. In 2013, Jaya Prada had met Congress president Sonia Gandhi and that also led to speculation that she would join the Congress. She had even announced that she was interested in getting back to her home state and would continue her political career there. She was keen on returning to AP politics but nothing concrete materialised. On Tuesday, she was welcomed into the BJP at the party’s headquarters in Delhi. “I am working with a brave leader in whose hands India is safe,” she said about Modi.
