Toppers\u2019 success maxim: Model paper.description: LUCKNOW: It was online question banks, model test papers and self-made notes that helped both engineering and law high scorers perform well. Those with good ranks in CLAT and JEE (Advanced) share that it was a daily practice that made their way easy to crack the national-level examinations. Securing all-India rank (AIR) 6 in CLAT, Priyanka Maurya said her success mantra involved “solving model papers of previous years as it develops a better understanding of fundamentals”. “The practice of writing answers for the subjective section by solving papers helped me a lot. I want to study human rights and international law from NLSIU, Bangalore, and make a successful career in the judiciary,” she said. Another high scorer of CLAT, Satyarth Srivastava, with AIR 47, also vouches for solving online question bank for good scores. He said, “I dropped a year to prepare for CLAT. I had taken the All India Law Entrance Test last year but the scores were not that great, then I took to online question bank for preparation which helped me score well.” Having the same belief, JEE high scorers are no different when it comes to preparation style. Tejesh Vaish, who secured 1,068th rank, shared that solving model papers helped him study topics which he had missed during preparation. “It all about being consistent with syllabus, having good mentors, self-made notes and solving model papers,” he said. Dolesh, who has secured AIR 1127 in JEE (Advanced) has the same opinion. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Critical day ahead for Lucknow as doctor.description: LUCKNOW: Health care services in the state capital will be crippled for 24 hours starting Monday 6am as over 10,000 medical practitioners, including those in government and private sectors, will strike work in solidarity with their brethren in West Bengal. Emergency and trauma services will be functional but there will be no out-patient-department (OPD) services and elective surgeries will have to be postponed. The resident doctors of King George’s Medical University (KGMU) and Queen Mary’s hospital, Sanjay Gandhi Post Graduate Institute of Medical Sciences (SGPGIMS) and Dr Ram Manohar Lohia Institute of Medical Sciences (RMLIMS) will stay away from work till Tuesday 6am. The 24-hour strike has been called by Indian Medical Association (IMA) in support of the stir of junior doctors of NRS Medical College, Kolkata, who were attacked on June 10. As a precautionary measure, chief medical officer (CMO) of Lucknow, Dr Narendra Agarwal has asked all district hospitals and community health care centres to be prepared for rush of patients and make necessary arrangements to ensure that no needy is deprived of medical care. If the strike is not called off, and services are hit, Dr Ram Manohar Lohia combined hospital, Lokbandhu Rajnarayan hospital, Balrampur hospital, Rani Laxmibai combined hospital, BRD hospital, Ram Sagar Mishra hospital, Veerangana Avanti Bai women’s hospital and Veerangana Jhalkari Bai women’s hospital would see a surge in patients. “The resident doctors’ associations of KGMU, SGPGIMS and RMLIMS have decided to strike on IMA’s call. We will not let emergency services get affected,” said KGMU RDA president, Dr Nayani Amrin. Not just medical colleges, private diagnostic and medical centres in the city will also join the strike. “The 1,000 diagnostic centres, pathology laboratories, nursing homes and private clinics affiliated to IMA and otherwise will also remain shut for 24 hours,” said IMA member, Dr PK Gupta. SGPGIMS faculty forum secretary Dr M S Ansari said that they support the cause but will not strike work. RDA president, Dr Ajay Shukla said, “There are 500 resident doctors at SGPGIMS, and all will be on strike. We will also take out protest march in morning and evening on Monday.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BSP List 2019 UP.description: LUCKNOW: The BSP on Friday announced its first list of 11 candidates for the Lok Sabha elections 2019, fielding JD(S) turncoat Kunwar Danish Ali from Amroha. Ali, who was general secretary of the Janata Dal-Secular, quit the party and joined the Bahujan Samaj Party only last week. The BSP also declared Haji Fazulrahman its nominee from Saharanpur, Malook Nagar from Bijnore and Girish Chandra from Nagina, a party release said. Hazi Mohammad Yakoob has been fielded from Meerut, Satbeer Nagar from Gautam Buddh Nagar, Yogesh Verma from Bulandshahr, Ajit Baliyan from Aligarh, Manoj Kumar Soni from Agra, Rajveer Singh from Fatehpur Sikri and Ruchi Veera from Aonla. Mayawati's BSP is contesting 38 of the 80 Lok Sabha constituencies in Uttar Pradesh under the seat-sharing arrangement with Samajwadi Party and the Rashtriya Lok Dal. Stress on anti-romeo squads, encourage w.description: LUCKNOW: The country’s largest police force got a new additional director general of police (law and order) on Monday. PV Ramasastry, an Indian Police Service (IPS) of 1989-batch has replaced Anand Kumar who was promoted to the rank of DG and has now been posted in the same capacity in the Prisons department. Ramasastry, in his first interaction with the newsmen in the capital, laid stress on the working of anti-romeo sqauds and also asked women to report about crime against them. Talking about the recent rapes in the state, the officer said "after a spate of such incidents there is usually a lull. This has happened time and again, but we will strive not to get such instances repeated,” added Ramasastry. The instructions down the line are very clear, that is only to work. "If any complaint comes in this department then action against the errant official is also taken very swiftly,” said Ramasastry, answering a question on corruption in the police department. Satta Matka 2018.description: AGRA: Shyam Vohra, known as 'satta king' of the Taj city, was denied bail by district court of Agra. Vohra, who was arrested by the Agra police in July for his alleged involvement in betting on FIFA World Cup matches. Earlier, in April, Vohra was arrested by the Nodia STF from Greater Noida for placing bets on IPL matches, but he was granted bail. After Vohra’s arrest, Agra police booked him and his known associates including his son Vatsal, wife Rakhi, nephew Prateek, brother-in-law Kaushal and others for their alleged involvement in betting. On Monday, judge Anil Kumar Pundhir rejected Vohra’s bail plea, who was charged for attempt to murder, as he allegedly opened fire on policemen. Further, Vohra was charged for running illegal gambling racket, criminal conspiracy and obstructing policemen from executing their duties. Police are yet to arrest the relatives and associates of Vohra. Several years back, Vohra had gain notoriety for betting on cricket matches. In April, during IPL matches, the gambling racket run by Vohra had deposited Rs 62 lakh in 10 banks, after which police approached banks to freeze the amount. Even during the FIFA World Cup, Vohra collected huge amount of cash through betting. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Lok Sabha Poll 2019.description: LUCKNOW: With electioneering for the 2019 Lok Sabha polls gaining steam in Uttar Pradesh, political leaders are increasingly resorting to personal attacks on their adversaries. If the maverick BJP MLA from Bairia, Surendra Singh hit the headlines for his remarks against BSP supremo Mayawati, Uttar Pradesh cabinet minister Shrikant Sharma hit a new low by making indecent comments on Congress chief Rahul Gandhi. The Bairia MLA had said Mayawati gets facials done and her hair coloured even though she is 60-years-old. He also reportedly made offensive remarks against UPA chairperson Sonia Gandhi and Haryanvi singer-dancer Sapna Chaudhary, evoking widespread criticism from political parties and social media users. A media agency quoted him as saying that both Sonia Gandhi and Sapna Chaudhary used to work as dancers. "Rahul's mother (Sonia Gandhi) was also in the same profession in Italy and his father made her his own. He (Rahul Gandhi) should also take the family tradition forward and make Sapna his own," the MLA said. The BJP legislator, who is known for his controversial statements, had earlier termed Rahul Gandhi and his sister Priyanka Gandhi Vadra "Ravana and Shurpanakha", and accused Mayawati of "murdering" a woman's dignity by joining hands with one-time arch rival Samajwadi Party. UP Power Minister Shrikant Sharma stirred up a hornet's nest with his tweet terming the Congress president a "coward and impotent". The comments triggered a war of words between the two parties as well as on social media platform. Firebrand Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath also finds mention in the list of leaders accused of making personal remarks against political rivals. He recently termed Congress candidate from Saharanpur, Imran Masood, the son-in-law of Jaish-e-Mohammed chief Azhar Masood. Addressing a rally in Saharanpur on Sunday, Adityanath said, "The son-in-law of Azhar Masood has entered the constituency and he speaks the language of the terror mastermind. "You people have to ensure that the person who speaks the language of Azhar Masood is defeated in the Lok Sabha elections," he said while seeking votes for BJP candidate from Saharanpur, Raghav Lakhanpal. Union minister and BJP MP Mahesh Sharma referred to Rahul Gandhi as 'Pappu' and his sister Priyanka Gandhi as 'Pappu ki Pappi' during a poll campaign in Gautam Buddh Nagar. Rahul Gandhi has often been mocked by the BJP and his opposition as 'Pappu', a colloquial sneer. "Pappu kehta hai main prime minister banunga Mayawati, Akhilesh Yadav, Pappu.. aur ab 'Pappu ki Pappi' bhi aa gayi hai. Wo Priyanka kya pehle hamare desh ki beti nahi thi kya, Congress ki beti nahi thi kya, aage nahi rahegi kya? kya naya leke aayi hai?" the minister told a crowd of his supporters on March 16. The quotes loosely translate to "Pappu says he wants to become prime minister. Mayawati, Akhilesh Yadav, Pappu ... and now 'Pappu's Pappi' has also arrived. Wasn't Priyanka already a daughter of this nation, a daughter of the Congress? And would she not remain so in future? What new has she brought in?" Lucknow: Mercury soars to 45C, breaches.description: LUCKNOW: As maximum temperature touched almost 45 degrees Celsius on Saturday, the city recorded its hottest day in the past two years. However, dust/thunderstorm may lash the state capital on Sunday. Dry hot winds coming from the desert region of Rajasthan revived the heat wave forcing maximum temperature to touch 44.9 degrees Celsius, seven degrees above normal, on Saturday. But it felt like 46-47 degrees Celsius in many parts of the city. Met officials said that dust/thunderstorm may occur on Sunday, bringing some relief from the hot conditions prevailing for the past two days. Maximum and minimum temperatures would be around 43 and 26 degrees Celsius, respectively. The relief will be short lived as temperatures are expected to soar again on Monday, followed by thunderstorm on Tuesday-Wednesday. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

No entry for 2-wheeler riders without he.description: LUCKNOW: Ten prominent routes in the city will become out of bounds for twowheeler riders without helmet from Monday. Also, these riders will be slapped with challans and will be allowed entry only after they pay a fine of Rs 500. Those not paying the fine on the spot fine will have to take alternate routes. Assistant superintendent of police (traffic) Purnendu Singh said helmet has been made mandatory across the city and offenders will be slapped with fine. The main focus will be on the 10 major routes during the drive. “We will gradually include more routes and compel people to follow traffic rules,” he said. “From next week, we will implement “no helmet, no petrol” drive in which riders without helmet will not get fuel at petrol pumps,” he added. Akhilesh meets Governor Ram Naik over la.description: LUCKNOW: Former Uttar Pradesh chief minister Akhilesh Yadav on Saturday met Governor Ram Naik and handed him over a memorandum to over 'deteriorating law and order' situation in the state. Talking to reporters after the meeting, Akhilesh said, "Never ever such heinous crimes against minor children and women were committed in the state. I want the Governor to awake the sleeping government." He said maximum cases of crimes took place on the day when chief minister Yogi Adityanath conducts meeting in Lucknow. Referring to murder of UP Bar Council president Darvesh Yadav, he said, "Murders are taking place in court chambers and jails where firearms are banned. Earlier, Governor used to say that there are Yadav officers across the state (over law and order issue) but now there is not a single superintendent of police or district magistrate of Yadav community in the state. So, I want him to make government awake on the increasing cases of crime." Akhilesh also said false cases are being framed against party leader and MP from Rampur, Azam Khan, to pressurise the party leadership. Recently, first woman chairperson of Bar Council of UP, Darvesh Yadav, was shot dead by another lawyer, Manish Sharma, inside Agra district court premises on June 12. Earlier, murder and rape of minor girls in Aligarh and Hamirpur caused outrage. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Absconding Lucknow University staffer ar.description: LUCKNOW: Police arrested Sanjay Singh Chauhan, the class-IV LU employee, on Sunday in the marksheet racket that was unearthed on April 17. Hassanganj police nabbed Chauhan from his sector-L Aliganj residence, under the jurisdiction of Vikasnagar police. It was the seventh arrest in the case since six persons, including a serving LU examination departmentemployee, Nayab Hussain, and ex-employee Kirodhan Prasad, who was sacked in 2003 for a similar offence, had been arrested. Chauhan was absconding since his involvement in the racket came to light, said police. During probe, the kingpin revealed names of two other LU class-IV employees, who were also suspended. “Hussain and Prasad revealed that tabulation charts were supplied by Chauhan,” said SHO Hassanganj Dhirendra Kushwaha. Chauhan will be taken on remand and questioned, he added. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

5 killed in UP's Balrampur as tractor tr.description: BALRAMPUR: Five persons, including three belonging to a family, were killed when the tractor trolley in which they were travelling overturned into a roadside ditch on Monday in Uttar Pradesh's Balrampur district, police said. Seventeen persons were also injured in the incident and have been admitted to the district hospital. Conditions of five of those injured were stated to be critical. Police said labourers working at a brick kiln were on their way to Lohepaniya village when the vehicle lost its balance and overturned near Kovapur. Those killed were identified as Bharat (25), his wife Resham (23), their son Nanhu (2), Satish (3) and Nandini (1). Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

CM Yogi Adityanath sets week's deadline.description: LUCKNOW: Chief minister Yogi Adityanath on Friday directed officials to ensure no school vehicle was allowed to ply on the road without a valid permit. Presiding over a review meeting of the education department, he also set a week's deadline for police verification of drivers and conductors so that the process was completed before schools reopened after summer vacation. Yogi said most private schools would reopen after June 20 and government ones after July 1, which meant police verification should be completed ahead of that. The CM's concerns over student safety stem from accidents involving school vehicles in the recent past. In March, a school bus overturned in Etah leaving several children injured. In Bhadohi earlier this year, at least 12 students suffered burns when a school bus caught fire from a leaking cooking gas cylinder strapped to the vehicle. In April 2018, 13 schoolchildren were killed when a school van was hit by a speeding train in Kushinagar. It was later found that the van did not have a valid permit and the driver, who also died in the mishap, was a minor. To streamline functioning of educational institutions in the state, the government had earlier slashed the number of holidays and this, Yogi said, was benefiting students. "In fact, the practice is being adopted by other state governments too," he said, adding that teachers must utilise holidays to communicate with parents. "Government school offices must thus reopen by June 25." The CM emphasised on constitution of Former Students' Council in every school, college and university. "Former students should be felicitated on August 15 and January 26. Many of them are now IAS and PCS officers, politicians or businessmen, who can financially assist their respective alma mater," he said. Yogi also harped on the need to conduct free and fair exams. No takers for Hindi, Urdu courses at LU.description: LUCKNOW: It is not just Hindi and Sanskrit which are not finding takers at Lucknow University but there are 15 such subjects out of the 39 offered which have seen dismal response. More than 40% seats in these BA or BA (Hons) courses are likely to remain vacant as candidates are not choosing them. The university will conduct the final counselling for the two courses on Tuesday. Till late Monday evening, as many as 489 seats in various subjects were lying vacant. With only a day left for admissions to be finalised, the chances of these seats getting filled are dim. In subjects like home science, Urdu, Arab culture, French, jyotir vigyan and Arabic, more than 30% of seats are vacant while in Persian, not a single seat of the 60 has a candidate. Even honours courses such as public policy and Hindi have failed to attract candidates with just 50% seats filled in both. For admission to 60 seats each in public policy and Hindi, only 28 and 31 candidates turned up, respectively. Admission coordinator Anil Mishra cited poor choice of career options and less familiarity of students with these subjects as the reasons behind the response.
